operation.descriptionCdata:
ae4d7358-94b1-4a0c-87cf-ea007560911e.2689b94f-df11-41c7-a479-a9fcc13db9e0.prompt=Password\: ae4d7358-94b1-4a0c-87cf-ea007560911e.8068b874-368c-49f6-b2ec-88082e72ac3f.prompt=Username\: ae4d7358-94b1-4a0c-87cf-ea007560911e.description=
This operation gets the number of active users logged in to a Windows host, and their account names.

Inputs\:
host - The host to get the users on.
username - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank for localhost). If you try to impersonate a user from another domain use the following format\: username@domain.
password - Password of the user.
delimiter - A delimiter to put between users that are active in the result.

Responses\:
success - the operation succeeded
failure - the operation failed for an unknown reason

Result\:
The raw result of the machine, containing all the infos returned about sessions.

ExtraResults\:
count - The number of users logged into host currently or in the past.
users - The usernames of all users logged into host currently or in the past.
terminalUsers - The usernames of all users logged into the host via terminal services.
inactiveUsers - The usernames of all users logged into the host but not currently connected.
localUsers - The usernames of all users logged into host locally.
stdOut - The entire response for the command.
stdErr - The error executing the command, if that is the case.

Note\: 
The username and password inputs should be empty if the operation is used against localhost.
This operation runs the windows command qwinsta on the Central machine. Thus, this operation requires a Windows Central. Also, Terminal Services Windows service should be running.
ae4d7358-94b1-4a0c-87cf-ea007560911e.f3d0da03-52b3-40f7-a0c1-ca812546e4cc.prompt=Hostname\:
operation.name: Get Active Users

scriptlet.name: Operation Get Active Users (850aa453-51a4-4ac2-ad64-30bf11d3c889)
